**Setup:** Plume Veil RDA; dual parallel @ .35Î©; cotton wicks; 45W

**Testing:** FLV Lemonade @ 3%; Aged: 7 days

**Flavor description:**  Very sweet lemony flavor, sugary, and rather dense on the tongue even at 3%.  Has some tang/tartness, but not too much.  Dry initally, but seems to develop some wetness after a steep.  Reminiscent of a lemonade powder mix.  More of a "Country Time" lemonade powder than say "Crystal Light".  

**Off-flavors:**  None noticed.  

**Throat hit:** 5/10. 

**Uses:**  Obviously a staple in a lemonade or even a tea type mix. (Think Arizona's Arnold Palmer)  Could be used to sweeten up a bitter lemon or any bitter citrus for that matter.  Would also work well in a lemon dessert with the help of something like FA Lemon Sicily to tone down/round out the sweetness factor.

**Pairings:** Light fruits, citrus fruits, bitter fruits, tea, meringue, champagne, possibly some lighter creams.

**Notes:** Not bad as a 3% standalone flavor, but seems to become more interesting at a lower % when mixed with other fruits.  There are probably endless possibilities to its uses with other fruit flavors.
